tests.question: list all paradigm (the health care company) rounds, the date, valuation, lead investor, and article source
tests.reasoning: The agent took a reasonable and defensible approach: it ran targeted SEARCH queries against organizations (including variants of 'Paradigm') and attempted to filter by healthcare via an organization_industries join — exactly the discovery steps described in the expected approach. It used 3 tool calls, which is within the expected budget. However, the agent did not complete the task: it stopped after discovery and asked a clarification instead of returning the requested list of funding rounds (date, valuation, lead investor, article source). Because the user asked for the list and the agent had already performed the necessary searches, the agent should have either (a) resolved the ambiguity itself by selecting the best-matching healthcare "Paradigm" org from the results and returning the rounds, or (b) presented the discovered candidate(s) and their IDs and then asked a targeted clarification. Instead it only asked whether the user meant a specific company (Paradigm Diagnostics) without providing any results. Therefore, despite a correct method and acceptable efficiency, the task was not completed and the output is incomplete.
tests.answer: Do you mean Paradigm Diagnostics (paradigmdx.com)? If yes I’ll pull all of its funding rounds with date, valuation, lead investor and the article link. If you mean a different Paradigm (another healthcare company), please give the domain or a distinguishing detail.
tests.expected_answer: Jan 29th 2023 Series A $203M led by ARCH Venture Partners and General Catalyst (https://www.finsmes.com/2023/01/paradigm-raises-203m-in-series-a-funding.html). Dec 4 2025 Series B $78B led by ARCH Venture Partners (https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/paradigm-health-raises-78-million-series-b-to-make-clinical-trials-part-of-routine-care-across-the-us-and-globally-302632924.html). Valuations not disclosed in either.
sql_queries:
SELECT id, name, domain, short_description, operating_status, country_code, total_raised, num_funding_rounds, latest_valuation_usd
FROM organizations
WHERE (
  SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigm')
  OR SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigm health')
  OR SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigm therapeutics')
  OR SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigm health care')
)
AND is_investor = FALSE
ORDER BY name
LIMIT 50;

SELECT id, name, domain, short_description, operating_status, country_code, is_investor
FROM organizations
WHERE SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigm')
ORDER BY name
LIMIT 200;

SELECT o.id, o.name, o.domain, o.short_description, o.country_code
FROM organizations o
JOIN organization_industries oi ON o.id = oi.organization_id
WHERE (SEARCH(o, 'paradigm') OR SEARCH(oi, 'paradigm'))
AND LOWER(oi.industry_name) LIKE '%health%'
AND o.is_investor = FALSE
LIMIT 50;
tests.expected_path: Identify Paradigm organization ID through discovery using SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigm') combined with healthcare industry filter via organization_industries. Filter deals by Paradigm organization_id while joining on articles and institutional_investments to get the round, date, lead investor, and article source
